channel.title: Space.com
channel.description: Get the latest space exploration, innovation and astronomy news. Space.com celebrates humanity's ongoing expansion across the final frontier.

item.title: It's Good! Hubble Telescope Scores Big with Football-Shaped Alien Planet
item.description: Heavy metals were seen escaping from the top of this odd, football-shaped exoplanet.
item.author: Passant Rabie

item.title: Epic '80s Sci-Fi Miniseries 'V' Remastered and Available on Blu-Ray
item.description: The sci-fi series "V" debuted in 1983 and considered an alien occupation of Earth.
item.author: Scott Snowden

item.title: The Brightest Visible Planets in August's Night Sky: How to See them (and When)
item.description: Here's how to see three naked-eye planets visible in August's night sky.
item.author: Joe Rao

item.title: Waxing Nostalgic About Apollo 11? Neil and Buzz Land at Madame Tussauds' Space Exhibit!
item.description: In an era of immersive experiences, Madame Tussauds in Washington, D.C., has a special one for space fans â€” the chance to interact with wax versions of Apollo 11 astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin.
item.author: Elizabeth Howell

item.title: 'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy' Is Coming to Hulu
item.description: A new TV series will be the latest in a long line of adaptations of the classic sci-fi comedy.
item.author: Scott Snowden

item.title: This 3D Map of the Milky Way Is the Best View Yet of Our Galaxy's Warped, Twisted Shape
item.description: A new 3D map of our Milky Way galaxy shows it has a warped and twisted shape, scientists say.
item.author: Charles Q. Choi

item.title: Space Launch Calendar 2019: Sky Events, Missions & More
item.description: Here's a guide to SpaceX's launch schedule, other rocket missions, astronomical events of the next year, as well as milestones for spacecraft already in travel.
item.author: Hanneke Weitering

item.title: NASA Chief Says Moon 2024 Plans Won't Rob Funds from Space Station
item.description: The U.S. has declared its intention to once again put boots on the moon. That sort of exploration comes with a giant price tag, leaving some to wonder where the money will come from.
item.author: Nola Taylor Redd

item.title: Peering at History from Orbit: 'Archaeology From Space' Author Talks New Book
item.description: Sometimes, it takes the very newest technology to find traces of humanity's ancient past.
item.author: Meghan Bartels

item.title: What Is a Dyson Sphere?
item.description: A Dyson sphere is the ultimate solution for living space and energy production.
item.author: Adam Mann

item.title: Pictures from Space! Our Image of the Day
item.description: A medallion from the European Astronaut Centre floats in microgravity in front of an Earth-facing window of the International Space Station.
item.author: Hanneke Weitering

item.title: Giant Magellan Telescope Project Finishes 2nd Primary Mirror
item.description: Two of the next-generation Giant Magellan Telescope's seven huge primary mirrors are now done.
item.author: Mike Wall

item.title: 2019 Full Moon Calendar
item.description: The full moon happens once a month. Find out when.
item.author: Tim Sharp

item.title: Moon Rocks and Lunar Meteorite Are the Stars in This NYC Exhibit
item.description: The American Museum of Natural History has just finished sprucing up its Halll of Meteorites to highlight a new era of sample-return missions and a new museum acquisition, a lunar meteorite.
item.author: Meghan Bartels

item.title: On This Day in Space! Aug. 1, 1968: Saturn V Rocket Production Ends
item.description: On Aug. 1, 1968, NASA canceled the production of its Saturn V moon rocket. See how it happened in our "On This Day in Space" video series!
item.author: Hanneke Weitering

item.title: Scientists Just Built a Mini-Sun in a Lab That Emits 'Plasma Burps'
item.description: Scientists built a miniature sun in the lab in order to gain more insight into solar physics.
item.author: Passant Rabie

item.title: Feel the Burn! Watch NASA's 2020 Mars Rover Do a Bicep Curl (Video)
item.description: In a mini-display of robot Olympian power, NASA's next Mars rover easily bicep-curled 88 lbs. (40 kilograms) in a California clean room.
item.author: Elizabeth Howell

item.title: 'The Expanse' Gets a Season 5 with Amazon (And Season 4's Coming in Hot!)
item.description: Belters, Martians and Earthers alike can rejoice as the best sci-fi series on TV surges on.
item.author: Scott Snowden

item.title: 'Snowball' Planets Might Be Better Abodes for Life Than We Thought
item.description: Frozen alien worlds might be capable of supporting a greater diversity and complexity of life than previously thought, a new study suggests.
item.author: Mike Wall

item.title: Solar Sail Success! LightSail 2 Is Officially Soaring on Sunlight
item.description: The Planetary Society has declared mission success for LightSail 2 after the craft was observed raising its orbit with the power of sunlight alone.
item.author: Chelsea Gohd

item.title: The Moon Is 100 Million Years Older Than We Thought, Apollo Rocks Show
item.description: A new study of Apollo lunar rocks suggests that the moon is older than anyone believed.
item.author: Elizabeth Howell

item.title: Could There Be Life? This Newfound 'Super-Earth' May Be Habitable
item.description: Scientists just discovered a "super-Earth" exoplanet that could harbor life.
item.author: Passant Rabie

item.title: 'Becoming Superman' Reveals Origin Story for 'Babylon 5' Creator
item.description: "Becoming Superman" is half family drama, half behind-the-scenes showbiz anecdotes, with a little writing advice and a few life lessons sprinkled in.
item.author: Marshall Honorof

item.title: Scientists Are Recruiting Bacteria to Mine Rock â€” in Space
item.description: A new space station experiment is testing whether would-be space miners can enlist some very small potential accomplices to do their grunt work.
item.author: Meghan Bartels

item.title: Russia Launches Progress 73 Cargo Ship on Speedy Flight to Space Station
item.description: The Russian-built Progress 73 cargo ship launched to the International Space Station Wednesday (July 31) on a 4-hour trek to the orbiting laboratory.
item.author: Tariq Malik

item.title: This Gassy 'Preteen' Exoplanet With 2 Suns Is Losing Its Atmosphere. But Why?
item.description: The discovery of an exoplanet orbiting a young star could provide new information on planet formation.
item.author: Passant Rabie

item.title: Move Over, Energizer Bunny! NASA's Mars 2020 Rover Just Got Its Nuclear Battery
item.description: NASA's next spacecraft on Mars is getting a nuclear battery to do science on the Red Planet.
item.author: Elizabeth Howell

item.title: Will Private Companies Beat NASA to the Moon?
item.description: NASA is working with private companies to send humans back to the moon. But what happens if those companies get there first?
item.author: Nola Taylor Redd

item.title: Earth's Core Has Been Leaking for 2.5 Billion Years and Geologists Don't Know Why
item.description: Earth's scorching core is not a loner â€” it has been caught mingling with other, underworldly layers.
item.author: Laura Geggel

item.title: Watch Live! Russia's Progress 73 Heads to Space Station Today
item.description: A Russian Progress 73 cargo ship will launch to the International Space Station today, July 31, at 8:10 a.m. EDT/1210 GMT. Watch it live!
item.author: SPACE.com Staff
